page.title: 03PORTHMADOG NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: Part of the estuary is a{conservation {area}where many resident and visiting {birds}may be seen.In the winter migratory birds visit.Curlews nest on the marshlands,and herons,swans, mallard and shellduck can be seen all year round.On the moorlands of Porthmeirion are tawny and barn owls, kestrels and mergansers.In the summer, siskins,swallows,martins and swifts fly in to join the resident finches warblers and usual hedgerow birds. Many{wild flowers}are found above the dunes near Borth-y-Gest:violets,roses, primroses,little bluebells,speedwell, thrift,saxifrage and hellebores;herbs such as tansy,comfrey,and sage:-all grow among the grass and blackthorn. The peninsula to the east is covered mainly with bellheather and bracken, rhododendrons grow on its southern side,havimg escaped from cultivation.
